etomica.chem.models

Class ModelChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.chem.models.Model
      • etomica.chem.models.ModelChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ModelChain
extends Model
    Model class for a simple chain molecule (homopolymer)
    See Also:

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Potential2 getBondingPotential()
      Returns the bonding potential used for adjacent atoms in the chain molecule.
      IConformation getConformation()
      Returns the Conformation for the molecule, or null if no Conformation has been set (a ConformationLinear will be used).
      IElement getElement()
      Returns the Element used for the leaf atoms in the chain, or null if no Element has been set (an ElementSimple will be used).
      int getNumAtoms()
      Returns the number of atoms per chain molecule.
      Model.PotentialAndIterator[] getPotentials()
      Returns an array of objects wrapping bonding Potentials and the AtomsetIteratorBasisDependents that return atoms appropriate for those potentials.
      protected void initPotentials(ISimulation sim)
      Internal method to be implemented by subclasses to initialize the intramolecular potentials associated with this model.
      protected ISpecies makeSpeciesInternal(ISimulation sim)
      Internal method to be implemented by subclasses to create the actual Species object for the given Simulation.
      void setBondingPotential(Potential2 newBondingPotential)
      Set the bonding potential for adjacent atoms in the chain molecule.
      void setConformation(IConformation newConformation)
      Sets the Conformation for the molecule.
      void setElement(IElement newElement)
      Sets the Element used for the leaf atoms in the chain.
      void setNumAtoms(int newNumAtoms)
      Sets the number of atoms per chain molecule.

      • bondingPotential

        protected Potential2 bondingPotential

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelChain

        public ModelChain(ISpace _space,
                  boolean isDynamic)
        Constructs a default ModelChain instance. The number of atoms per chain must be set before making the Species. The conformation and element can also be set if desired.

    • Method Detail

      • setBondingPotential

        public void setBondingPotential(Potential2 newBondingPotential)
        Set the bonding potential for adjacent atoms in the chain molecule. The given potential must not be range-dependent. This method must be invoked before making the Species and must not be invoked after creating the Species.

      • getBondingPotential

        public Potential2 getBondingPotential()
        Returns the bonding potential used for adjacent atoms in the chain molecule.

      • setNumAtoms

        public void setNumAtoms(int newNumAtoms)
        Sets the number of atoms per chain molecule. The number of atoms must be positive. This method may not be invoked after creating the Species.

      • getNumAtoms

        public int getNumAtoms()
        Returns the number of atoms per chain molecule.

      • setConformation

        public void setConformation(IConformation newConformation)
        Sets the Conformation for the molecule. If no Conformation is set, a ConformationLinear will be used.

      • getConformation

        public IConformation getConformation()
        Returns the Conformation for the molecule, or null if no Conformation has been set (a ConformationLinear will be used).

      • setElement

        public void setElement(IElement newElement)
        Sets the Element used for the leaf atoms in the chain.

      • getElement

        public IElement getElement()
        Returns the Element used for the leaf atoms in the chain, or null if no Element has been set (an ElementSimple will be used).

      • initPotentials

        protected void initPotentials(ISimulation sim)
        Description copied from class: Model
        Internal method to be implemented by subclasses to initialize the intramolecular potentials associated with this model. Potential objects might be created earlier, but this method gives the subclass an opportunity to create the potentials after the species. This method will only be called after the species has been created.
        Specified by:
        initPotentials in class Model

      • getPotentials

        public Model.PotentialAndIterator[] getPotentials()
        Description copied from class: Model
        Returns an array of objects wrapping bonding Potentials and the AtomsetIteratorBasisDependents that return atoms appropriate for those potentials.
        Specified by:
        getPotentials in class Model

      • makeSpeciesInternal

        protected ISpecies makeSpeciesInternal(ISimulation sim)
        Description copied from class: Model
        Internal method to be implemented by subclasses to create the actual Species object for the given Simulation.
        Specified by:
        makeSpeciesInternal in class Model
